skillTree.localised_description: The Fly Lord and his devotees despise Tzeentch, for his obsession with schemes and trickery are the polar opposite of Nurgle's delight in slow, musty stagnation.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Tzeentchian factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Tzeentchian factions

skillTree.localised_description: Anything fired at this vile Nurglish servant's immense girth must penetrate many folds of sweaty fat before they even have the slightest chance of piercing his flesh.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: The dread carriages of the Ruinous hosts are more than just machines of war; they are symbols of status and power.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
So blessed is this champion with Nurgleâ€™s foetid restorative powers that his body heals itself as fast as his enemies can harm him.

Those exposed to the aural shock waves of the Dolorous Knell are sent reeling, clutching their skulls in agony as infected pus leaks from their ears and eyes, and a plague of panic and terror spreads like wildfire through their ranks.
Such are this Warlordâ€™s virulent emanations that his very presence isenough to make even the most lethal toxins and venoms deadlier still.
Empyric fever-heat burns through the championâ€™s brain, causing it to atttack with ever more frenzied ferocity.
Saturated as he is with Nurgleâ€™s contagious blessings, merely to stand before this champion is to be assailed by an oppressive aura of plague.
Nurgle is eager to bestow daemonic fecundity upon his faithful servants, sealing their gaping wounds with pulsating growths and replacing their spilt blood with curdling ichor.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
The WatcherÂ´s body has become swollen with Nurgleâ€™s divine blessings, and stands all but inviolate as a veritable behemoth of rancid flesh.
Unholy diseases warp and mutate, sending their carriers into a froth-jawed killing fever to the ruin of all.

skillTree.localised_description: Nurgle is a generous god, and through worship and devotion his followers can gain mighty rewards. Those who prove themselves most worthy wield suppurating weapons of unspeakable foulness, or gird themselves in weeping armour of filth.

skillTree.localised_description: A poisonous malady so hideous, even death is no escape.

skillTree.localised_description: The air most creatures breathe provides just another avenue of attack for Nurgle and his many and varied contagions.

skillTree.localised_description: Blade and point and spell can be turned aside very easily by the Fly Lord's most-favoured servants.

skillTree.localised_description: Sulphurous, acerbic disease is no respecter of rank, nobility or prowess in battle; all shall fall afore Nurgle's filthy infections.

ui_effects.localised_text: Will spread to enemies within the Spread Range metres of affected unit

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +4%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +8%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +12%

skillTree.localised_description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption â€“ as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Just as all life is born, so it must wither and die. Before that happens comes disease, in all its disgusting, filth-ridden glory.
Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those corrupted by Nurgle's rot flock to his putrid banner in the hope that they will be reborn anew in Grandfather's image.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fightâ€¦ or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you spend almost any time too close to this vile infector you'll regret it, assuming you live to tell the tale that is.

effects.description:
Chance of a plague spreading: +10%
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Unusually subtle for one so foul, this one is skilled in spreading Nurgle's insanitary ways and words across the land.

effects.description:
Enemy leadership: -4
	(enemy armies in local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one finds the enemy can barely stand to come near them, let alone attack.

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: When this one's countless lesions and warts finish weeping and harden up, a natural, protective carapace is left behind in their place.
If a population are confined to their toilets or beds at home they're not able to spread dissent and sedition as readily, if at all.

effects.description:
Infection cost to create a Plague: -10%
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Ogres aside, being this large and ungainly would almost certainly kill most other creatures, but when you're beloved of the Urfather it is actually an advantage.
